author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body: What is lacking in the MKL support in Pardiso.jl?

Hi @KristofferC 

Pardiso.jl is great! I am not trying to replicate its functionality. 

I need direct access to the low level fortran routines in Pardiso to have fine control. I haven't found so thin wrappers in Pardiso.jl (e.g., is it possible to access `pardiso_64`?) That's why I have written the repo, mainly for my own purposes, but it can be also useful for someone else.

Okay, it would be useful if you could open up an issue on Pardiso.jl with what you need. We could eg add a layer for direct access to the Fortran functions there if you want. 

It personally feels a bit unnecessary to spread out too much code over different packages about something as specific as just wrapping Pardiso.

Not that this PR can't be merged, it is just a good long term goal to try have a Pardiso package that works for everyone.

Hi @KristofferC 

thanks for your comments. I see your point. It would be much better if Pardiso.jl provides also low level access to the pardiso mkl  subroutines (this is actually what I was looking for at the beginning but didn't find it in the package). 

First, I thought to create a fork of Pardiso.jl, add what I needed, and then open a PR. However, two things prevented me of doing this:

1) I was not able to properly install Pardiso.jl in my system. I think that gcc-6 is not supported. And custom installations of gcc are not supported neither.

2) The Pardiso.jl does not have Project.toml and a Manifest.toml files. I am quite new in Julia and I don't know how to work with packages that don't follow the new project structure.

We can work together to solve these two issues.  Then I can add the functionality of `PardisoMKL.jl` into `Pardiso.jl` (essentially the functions in the API section of the [README.md](https://github.com/fverdugo/PardisoMKL.jl/blob/master/README.md) file with perhaps slightly different names if you wish)

For me would be nice to contribute to Pardiso.jl and for you would be nice to have Pardiso.jl improved.

What is your opinion?
Seems like a good idea to me.

I am currently on a vacation trip. Once I am back, Iâ€™ll try to patch Pardiso.jl so that it can be installed in my machine and open a PR. Once this is done, I can add the low level functions I need and open another PR.  Regards!
I'm going to close this for now. If you want to register, just re-trigger with registrator.
